result.execSummary:
Michael Wayne Johnson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Michael Wayne Johnson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Wayne Johnson

records.addlTxt: 9:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Wayne Johnson appeared by video, in custody appearing from Bayfield County Jail.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Michael Wayne Johnson.  Case on for status conference.  Court recaps- def awaiting governor's warrant.  Court addresses the defendant, asks if he wishes to be extradited to MN.  Court advises defendant of rights.  Def waives extradition KIV.  Def to be extradited to the State of Minnesota.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.

2:59 PM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Wayne Johnson in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Michael Wayne Johnson.  Case on for extradition hearing.  Court reviews paperwork- def to be extradited to Pine County, MN.  Atty Otten updates the Court- defendant does not want to waive extradition rights, wishes to have the full formal process of a governor's warrant, understands he'll sit in custody until that can be done.  DA to start the governor's warrant process, def to remain in BC custody until that can be accomplished.

1:15 PM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Wayne Johnson appeared by video. Case on for extradition hearing.  Court addresses def, advises him of his rights regarding extradition and counsel.  Court to adjourn this hearing as defendant does not seem to understand today's proceedings.
Extradition hearing on July 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Waiver of Extradition and Hearing w/Defendant's signature
Waiver of Extradition and Hearing (unsigned- forwarded to the jail for signature 7/6/22)
